Specialized tattoo removal center in Bogotá

Remove your tattoos with visible results from the first session

Are you considering removing a tattoo in Bogotá? At our specialized medical center, Dr. Tatiana Leal uses the advanced COLORMAX Q-SWITCHED Nd:YAG laser, a state-of-the-art technology that delivers visible results from the first session, especially for tattoos with black, blue, and red pigments.

Unlike other methods, our COLORMAX laser emits a precise amount of energy at specific wavelengths for each tattoo color. This precision allows the fragmentation of ink particles located under the skin, which, due to their size, the body's cleaning cells cannot naturally eliminate. Once fragmented, your immune system can process and eliminate them gradually and safely.

How much does it cost to remove a tattoo in Colombia? Prices and factors

The cost to remove a tattoo in Colombia varies depending on specific factors that we evaluate during your initial consultation. Our prices are competitive and transparent:

Small tattoos (up to 5cm)

Starting at $300,000 per session

Ideal for discreet tattoos on the wrist, ankle, or fingers.

Generally requires 4-6 sessions for amateur tattoos and 6-8 for professional ones.

Medium tattoos (5-10cm)

Starting at $500,000 per session

Perfect for tattoos on forearms, shoulders, or ankles.

Usually needs 6-8 sessions for amateur tattoos and 8-10 for professional ones.

Large tattoos (over 10cm)

Starting at $800,000 per session

For extensive tattoos on the back, chest, or full arms.

Generally requires 8-12 sessions depending on ink density and colors.

Other factors that influence the final price include:

  • Type of pigment: Black and blue colors usually require fewer sessions.
  • Professional vs amateur tattoo: Professional tattoos generally need more sessions.
  • Age of the tattoo: Older tattoos may respond better to treatment.
  • Ink density: Higher density means more sessions.

We offer treatment plans with discounts for session packages and payment options to make the treatment more accessible.

During your initial consultation with Dr. Tatiana Leal, you will receive a complete analysis of your tattoo and a detailed personalized quote with the estimated number of sessions and the total cost of the treatment. Schedule your evaluation now with no obligation.

Advanced precision medical technology

How is tattoo removal performed with the COLORMAX laser?

The removal process with the COLORMAX Q-SWITCHED Nd:YAG laser is a precise and scientifically proven procedure that works through a photoacoustic principle. During the treatment, the laser emits energy at specific wavelengths tailored to each particular tattoo color (black, blue, or red).

When these energy waves hit the ink particles under the skin, they fragment them into much smaller pieces. This process is crucial because the body's cleaning cells cannot naturally eliminate large ink particles, but they can process and eliminate these smaller fragments.

The procedure is quick and relatively comfortable thanks to our integrated cooling system and the use of topical anesthesia when necessary. Most sessions last between 15-45 minutes depending on the size of the tattoo and the density of the pigment.

How long does it take to completely remove a tattoo?

The number of sessions needed to completely remove a tattoo varies depending on several specific factors:

  • Type of pigment: Some pigments respond better to the laser than others. Black, blue, and red tones respond best to our COLORMAX technology.
  • Number of passes by the tattoo artist: The more passes the tattoo artist made, the more sessions will be needed to completely remove the pigment.
  • Origin of the tattoo: Professional tattoos generally require more sessions than amateur ones due to the quality and depth of the pigments used.
  • Age of the tattoo: Interestingly, newer tattoos may require more sessions than older ones, as the pigment is fresher and more concentrated.
  • Anatomical location: Areas with better circulation respond more quickly to treatment.

After your personalized evaluation, Dr. Tatiana Leal will be able to estimate the approximate number of sessions needed for your specific case, usually spaced 6-8 weeks apart to allow for complete skin recovery.

Post-treatment care to optimize results

To ensure the best results and optimal recovery after each COLORMAX laser removal session, it is essential to follow these specific recommendations:

  • Avoid direct sun exposure on the treated area for at least 15 days
  • Avoid vigorous exercise for 3 days
  • Avoid rubbing or scratching the treated area to prevent irritation
  • Avoid hot showers, saunas, steam rooms, and pools until the skin is completely healed
  • Apply the recommended healing ointment as instructed

Following these recommendations not only speeds up your recovery but also optimizes the natural elimination of fragmented pigments, significantly improving the final results of the treatment.

We care for your skin, we care for you

Our commitment is to offer you visible results from the first session with the utmost respect for the integrity of your skin.

Tattoo removal in Bogotá: step-by-step process

  1. Initial evaluation

    During the first consultation, Dr. Tatiana Leal will evaluate your tattoo, analyzing factors such as size, colors, ink density, whether it's professional or amateur, and its age. This evaluation allows us to determine the approximate number of sessions needed and provide you with a detailed quote.

  2. Preparation for treatment

    We apply topical anesthesia to maximize your comfort during the procedure. Our COLORMAX laser system has an integrated cooling system that significantly reduces discomfort.

  3. Application of the COLORMAX laser

    The laser emits energy pulses that penetrate the skin and are selectively absorbed by the ink particles. This energy fragments the particles into smaller pieces that your immune system can naturally eliminate.

  4. Post-treatment care

    You will receive detailed instructions on how to care for the treated area, including the application of healing ointments, avoiding sun exposure, and other specific recommendations to optimize results.

  5. Follow-up sessions

    Sessions are scheduled every 6-8 weeks to allow the skin to fully recover and the immune system to process and eliminate the ink fragments. With each session, you will notice a progressive reduction in the tattoo's visibility.

Differences between removing professional vs amateur tattoos

CharacteristicProfessional TattoosAmateur Tattoos
Average number of sessions8-12 sessions4-8 sessions
Ink depthDeeper and more uniformGenerally more superficial
Pigment densityHigh density and saturationLow/medium density
Response to treatmentGradual and progressiveFaster and more noticeable
Approximate priceHigher total investmentLower total investment

In both cases, our COLORMAX Q-SWITCHED Nd:YAG laser delivers visible results from the first session, with the advantage that amateur tattoos usually require fewer total sessions for complete removal.

Can all types of tattoos be removed?

Currently, our COLORMAX Q-SWITCHED Nd:YAG laser is specifically designed to effectively remove three types of pigments:

Black Pigments

Black is the color that responds best to laser treatment, with visible results from the first session. The specific wavelength of the COLORMAX laser efficiently fragments black ink particles.

Blue Pigments

Bluish tones respond very well to our Q-SWITCHED laser system, which uses a specialized wavelength for this color spectrum, achieving effective fragmentation.

Red Pigments

The COLORMAX technology allows effective treatment of reddish tones thanks to its ability to emit energy at specific wavelengths for this color.

For tattoos with other colors like green, yellow, or orange, we can evaluate complementary options during your consultation. The effectiveness of the treatment is always determined through a personalized evaluation with Dr. Tatiana Leal.

Frequently asked questions about tattoo removal with COLORMAX laser

The cost of removing a tattoo in Colombia varies depending on several factors: size (starting at $300,000 for small tattoos up to 5cm and up to $9,000,000 for very large tattoos), type of pigment, whether it's professional or amateur, and its age. Professional tattoos usually require more sessions than amateur ones. During your evaluation, Dr. Tatiana Leal will provide a personalized quote considering all these variables..

The COLORMAX Q-SWITCHED Nd:YAG laser works by emitting a precise amount of energy at a specific wavelength for each tattoo color. This energy penetrates the skin and is selectively absorbed by the tattoo ink particles. The impact fragments these particles into smaller pieces, allowing the body's immune system (macrophages) to naturally eliminate them. The laser is particularly effective on reddish, bluish, and black pigments..

Results are visible from the first session, with progressive lightening of the tattoo. Most of our patients notice a significant reduction in color intensity after the first treatment. However, the degree of improvement varies depending on factors such as the type of pigment, depth of the ink, and skin characteristics..

The number of sessions varies depending on several factors: 1) The type of pigment used, as some respond better to the laser than others; 2) The number of passes the tattoo artist made, as more passes require more sessions; 3) Whether it's a professional or amateur tattoo, with professional tattoos being more difficult to remove; 4) The age of the tattoo, with newer tattoos requiring more sessions. The size of the tattoo and the patient's skin type also play a role..

The price varies depending on size: for small tattoos up to 5cm, the approximate cost is $300,000 per session. For medium tattoos (5-10cm), the price ranges between $500,000 and $700,000 per session. Large tattoos (over 10cm) can cost from $800,000 per session. We offer treatment plans with discounts for session packages and payment options to make the treatment more accessible..

With our COLORMAX Q-SWITCHED Nd:YAG laser, we can effectively remove black, bluish, and reddish pigments. For each color, the laser uses a specific wavelength that maximizes energy absorption for that particular pigment. It's important to note that some colors like green, yellow, and orange may require complementary technologies or more sessions for complete removal..

After the treatment, we recommend: 1) Avoiding direct sun exposure on the treated area for 15 days; 2) Avoiding vigorous exercise for 3 days; 3) Not rubbing or scratching the treated area to prevent irritation; 4) Avoiding hot showers, saunas, steam rooms, and pools until the skin is completely healed; 5) Applying the recommended healing ointment as instructed during the procedure..

The sensation during the treatment varies from person to person, but it is generally described as similar to small snaps of a rubber band against the skin.
